alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Franklin; Granville; Orange; Vance; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 9:12AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Vance, southeastern Orange, southern Granville, northwestern Wake, Durham, northeastern Chatham and northwestern Franklin Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 911 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bunn to near RDU International to 10 miles west of Fuquay-Varina. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Creedmoor, Pittsboro, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Carrboro and Butner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Chatham; Durham; Franklin; Granville; Orange; Vance; Wake
